today_in_history_posts.title: Waiting SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT and Packing Packages
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The post examines Lightning network issues like pre-signed feerate and transaction pinnings.
- Antoine Riard recommends solutions such as package-relay for pre-signed feerate problems.
- The author stresses considering anti-DoS for package-relay and proposes a deployment timeline.

today_in_history_posts.title: Waiting SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT and Packing Packages
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard discusses pre-signed feerate issue and malicious transaction pinnings in the Lightning network.
- Solutions like package-relay or SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT are recommended for the pre-signed feerate issue.
- The post proposes early package-relay deployment in Bitcoin Core for efficient Lightning Network transactions.

today_in_history_posts.title: Estimating Likelihood for Lightning Payments to be (in)feasible
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rene Pickhardt develops a paper on understanding payment channel networks using geometric concepts.
- His work proposes a method to compute Lightning Network payment success without knowing liquidity distributions.
- Pickhardt's approach challenges traditional liquidity models, aiming to improve network design and pathfinding.
